title.narrative: IMPROVING QUALITY OF EDUCATION

description.narrative: Teachers have increased capacity to deliver and sustain quality education that conforms to national standards, which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Eritrean girls and boys in four Zobas have access to quality Basic Education and Child Protection Services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Teachers have increased capacity to deliver and sustain quality education that conforms to national standards

description.narrative: With the support of UNICEF MoE delivered pre- and in-service training for 7,763 teachers focused on improving their pedagogic and classroom practices and school development planning aligned to COVID-19 infection prevention and control. This total included 6,700 newly recruited direct teachers who attended induction training on lesson planning, classroom management, learning assessment and child centred pedagogy, strengthening their capacity to deliver and sustain quality education. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
